issue.title: Feature request: FlashAttention

labels.name: Priority: P1 - soon
labels.description: Assignee is working on this now, among other tasks. (Assignee required)

issue.body:
Hey,
There is an implementation for [this](https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.14135) memory efficient version of attention [here](https://github.com/lucidrains/flash-attention-jax).
And I was wondering if it is possible to somehow integrate it into Flax.

comment.body: @IvyZX  could you please share the link for the current PR ?

pull_request.title: fixed mypy errors at HEAD
pull_request.body:
fixed mypy [errors](https://github.com/google/flax/actions/runs/6633647201/job/18063731667#step:9:56) at HEAD:
```
flax/linen/fp8_ops.py:177: error: Argument 1 to "dot_general" has incompatible type "ReturnValue"; expected "Array | ndarray[Any, Any] | bool_ | number[Any] | bool | int | float | complex"  [arg-type]
flax/linen/fp8_ops.py:177: error: Argument 2 to "dot_general" has incompatible type "ReturnValue"; expected "Array | ndarray[Any, Any] | bool_ | number[Any] | bool | int | float | complex"  [arg-type]
flax/linen/fp8_ops.py:185: error: Incompatible return value type (got "ReturnValue", expected "Array")  [return-value]
```
The cause of the error is because [`customvjp`](https://github.com/google/flax/pull/3440/files#diff-06017f1d3c34fb3901ed1c1748b278b2febf1337ac520724de0916395c96cdcaR82) is applied to `in_qdq`, causing it to have a return type of [`TypeVar('ReturnValue')`](https://github.com/google/jax/blob/main/jax/_src/custom_derivatives.py#L586), which causes mypy to throw errors.

issue.title: [NVIDIA] Update the algorithm to compute fp8 scales
issue.body:
This pull request implements updates to the algorithm for computing new FP8 scales, in line with the design outlined in the following documentation: https://docs.nvidia.com/deeplearning/transformer-engine/user-guide/api/jax.html#transformer_engine.jax.update_fp8_metas.

cc. @wenscarl @reedwm @lukaszlew @levskaya

comment.body: @levskaya thank you for bringing this to my attention. I've removed the function return value annotation that was causing the previous mypy check to trigger. I don't believe it's necessary because this custom operation for FP8 is not configured to the layers, such as DenseGeneral, by default. There won't be any other type checking tracing back to this operation.

pull_request.title: [NVIDIA] Update the FP8 support
pull_request.body:
This pull request refactors the FP8 support by utilizing the newly introduced collection name `overwrite_with_gradient` which can better describe how the FP8-related parameters should be updated. I've moved the tests to `linen_test.py` as it is a more suitable location. Additionally, I have performed some code cleanup to enhance clarity.

It's important to note that the `overwrite_with_gradient` collection was recently introduced to PAX and Praxis through the merging of these four pull requests:

(1) https://github.com/google/praxis/pull/29
(2) https://github.com/google/paxml/pull/48
(3) https://github.com/google/praxis/pull/28
(4) https://github.com/google/paxml/pull/49

Therefore, this pull request also aims to ensure consistency in the usage of FP8 across various JAX frameworks.

cc. @wenscarl @lukaszlew @nluehr
